item.title: Compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

You’ll need to set your environment variables as well, downloading Java isn’t enough to get the compiler working.

item.title: Compiler?
item.dc:creator: @kinta kinta
item.description:
@kinta wrote:

IDK why it’s not compiling but try this

@echo off
color 4
title Compiler
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

works fine for me

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler?
item.dc:creator: @range_ftw101 range ftw101
item.description:
@range_ftw101 wrote:

I was wondering if anyone could help me by telling me why my compiler wont compile, if u know please answer this question below! it always says "the system cannot find the path specified =/ it currently is:

@echo off
@TITLE Clawz Pkz Compiler
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You Havent Downloaded Java …
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

if you could give me a new one that would be great!

             Thanks!, range ftw101

Read full topic
